required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Famitinib in Patients With Failure of First-Line Treatment For Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Arm, Open-Label, Multi-Center, Phase II Study of Famitinib Malate to Treat Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma Patients With FGFR2(Fibroblast Growth Factor Receptor2) Genetic Aberrations Who Failed First-Line Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-arm, open-label, multi-center Phase II clinical trial intended to observe and evaluate the efficacy and safety of famitinib malate in treating iCCA(Intrahepatic Cholangiocarcinoma ) patients with FGFR2 genetic aberrations who failed first-line therapy.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-defined intervals from initial dose up to 24 months

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events (AE) and serious adverse event (SAE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-defined intervals from initial dose up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Including incidence, grade (according to CTCAE V5.0 criteria), severity, duration, and causality with investigational drug

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentrations of famitinib and its N-desethyl metabolite
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At pre-defined intervals from initial dose up to 24 months
